label: @LOANPROJECTINTERESTTYPE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Interest Type
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Loan Type field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Interest Type
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Interest Type
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTLOANDATE
description:
Data source 1 = Loan record Interest Date
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Interest Date
Otherwise = System date

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENTTYPE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Payment Type
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Loan Type field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Payment Type
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Payment Type
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTAMORTIZESCHEDULE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Amortize Schedule
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Amortize Schedule field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Amortize Schedule

label: @LOANPROJECTAMORTIZESCHDTYPE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Amortize Schedule Type
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Amortize Schedule Type field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Amortize Schedule Type
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Amortize Schedule Type
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENTFREQUENCY
description:
Data source 0 = 0
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Payment Frequency
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Payment Frequency
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Payment Frequency
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Payment Frequency

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENTSKIPS
description:
Data source 1, 3, 5, 7 = Loan record Payment Skips
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Loan Type field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 6, 8 = Application record Payment Skips
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENTSKIPSTARTDAY
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record payment Skip Start Day
Data source 2, 4 = Initialized from the loan type defaults specified by the Loan Type field in the application when you initialize from an existing application or from an application default.
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Skip Start Day
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Skip Start Day
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTDUEDAY1
description:
Data source 0 = 0
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Due Day 1
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Due Day 1
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Due Day 1
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Due Day 1

label: @LOANPROJECTDUEDAY2
description:
Data source 0 = 0
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Due Day 2
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Due Day 2
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Due Day 2
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Due Day 2

label: @LOANPROJECTFIRSTDUEDATE
description:
Data source 0 = --/--/--
Data source 1 = Calculate next due date on or after Interest Date and system date
Data source 3 = Loan record (default) Due Date
Data source 2, 4 = Application record first Due Date
Data source 5, 7 = Calculate first due date on or after Loan (LOC) Segment record Interest Date and system date
Data source 6, 8 = Calculate next due date on or after system date

label: @LOANPROJECTBALLOONDATE
description:
Data source 0 = --/--/--
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Balloon Date
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Balloon Date
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Balloon Date
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Balloon Date

label: @LOANPROJECTBALLOONAMOUNT
description:
Data source 0 = $0.00
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Balloon Amount
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Balloon Amount
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Balloon Amount
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Balloon Amount

label: @LOANPROJECTUNPAIDINTEREST
description:
Data source 1, 5, 7 = Loan, Loan Segment 0 or Segment record Interest Unpaid
Otherwise = $0.00

The unpaid interest variable does not have a corresponding projection screen field, but is necessary for calculations involving existing loans.

label: @LOANPROJECTINTERESTRATE
description:
Data source 0 = 0.000%
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Interest Rate
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Interest Rate
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Interest Rate
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Interest Rate

label: @LOANPROJECTFIRSTINSBIRTHDATE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record First Insured Birth Date
Data source 2, 4 = Application record First Insured Birth Date
Data source 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record First Insured Birth Date
Data source 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record First Insured Birth Date
Otherwise = --/--/--

label: @LOANPROJECTSECONDINSBIRTHDATE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Second Insured Birth Date
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Second Insured Birth Date
Data source 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Second Insured Birth Date
Data source 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Second Insured Birth Date
Otherwise = --/--/--

label: @LOANPROJECTINSURANCETYPE
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Insurance Type
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Insurance Type
Data source 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Insurance Type
Data source 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Insurance Type
Otherwise = 0

label: @LOANPROJECTSINGLEPREMIUM
description:
Data source 0 = 1
Otherwise = 0

Pass this premium to LOANPROJECTCALC. In general, you use 2 when printing disclosures, in which case you fill in the @LOANPROJECTLIFE and the @LOANPROJECTDISABILITY from the single premium insurance fields in the loan or application. The single premium insurance amounts have been calculated previously and stored so that they are not recalculated when the loan is disbursed.

You use 0 when calculating a payoff where no new single premium insurance is added.

You use 1 when you are calculating a brand new loan and need to calculate the single premium amounts.

The system ignores this field if the @LOANPROJECTINSURANCETYPE does not reference a single premium calculation.

label: @LOANPROJECTESCROWAMOUNT
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Escrow Amount
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Escrow Amount
Data source 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Escrow Amount
Data source 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Escrow Amount
Otherwise = $0.00

label: @LOANPROJECTPREPAIDFINANCECHG
description:
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Prepaid Finance Chg
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Prepaid Finance Chg
Data source 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Prepaid Finance Chg
Data source 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Prepaid Finance Chg
Otherwise = $0.00

label: @LOANPROJECTCALCULATIONTYPE
description: The default is (2) Calculate Loan Term since the loan amount and payment have already been calculated in most cases.

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENT
description:
Data source 0 = $0.00
Data source 1 = Loan Payment (or from appropriate Pmt Bucket Amt)
Data source 3 = Loan record (default) Payment
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Payment
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Payment (or from appropriate Pmt Bucket Amt)
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Payment (or from appropriate Pmt Bucket Amt)

label: @LOANPROJECTLOANAMOUNT
description:
Data source 0 = $0.00
Data source 1 = Loan record Balance
Data source 2 = Application record Loan Amount
Data source 3 = Loan record (default) Original Balance
Data source 4 = Application record (default) Loan Amount
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Balance
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Loan Amount

label: @LOANPROJECTMATURITYDATE
description:
Data source 0 = --/--/--
Data source 1, 3 = Loan record Maturity Date
Data source 2, 4 = Application record Maturity Date
Data source 5, 7 = Loan (LOC) Segment record Maturity Date
Data source 6, 8 = Application (LOC) Segment record Maturity Date

Insert in this variable the term date for the calculation, rather than the number of loan months, as for interactive loan projections. The system ignores this value if you choose to calculate the Term Date.

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYOFFDATE
description:
Data source 0-4 = Current system date

If you select (3) Calculate Loan Payoff for @LOANPROJECTCALCULATIONTYPE, enter the expected loan payoff date here. If you do not provide a date, The system assumes the current system date.

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYOFFINTDATE
description: Sets the day that interest begins to accrue

label: @LOANPROJECTPROMO1RATE
description:
Data source 1 = Loan record Promo 1 Rate
Data source 3 = Loan default Promo 1 Rate
Otherwise = 0.000%

label: @LOANPROJECTPROMO2RATE
description:
Data source 1 = Loan record Promo 2 Rate
Data source 3 = Loan default Promo 2 Rate
Otherwise = 0.000%

label: @LOANPROJECTPROMO1BALANCE
description:
Data source 1 = Loan record Promo 1 Balance
Otherwise= $0.00

label: @LOANPROJECTPROMO2BALANCE
description:
Data source 1 = Loan record Promo 2 Balance
Otherwise = $0.00

label: @LOANPROJECTMILITARYAPRLOAN
description: Data Source: Supplied by the calling specfile; if you do not use this variable, Projections uses the value in the Military APR Loan field in the related Loan or Application record

label: @LOANPROJECTMAPRPREPAIDFINCHG
description: Data Source: Supplied by the calling specfile; the amount is used in the calculation

label: @LOANPROJECTMILITARYAPR
description: Calculated military APR for close-end loans; the specfile receives this rate as a result of the calculation

label: @LOANPROJECTMAPRTOTALFEES
description: Total fees used in calculating military APR for closed-end loans; the specfile receives this amount to use in the calculation

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENT
description: Calculated payment if @LOANPROJECTCALCULATIONTYPE = (0) Calculate Payment Amount

label: @LOANPROJECTLOANAMOUNT
description:
Calculated payment if @LOANPROJECTCALCULATIONTYPE = (1) Calculate Loan Amount
Important: The default for @LOANPROJECTCALCULATIONTYPE = (2) Calculate Loan Term since the loan amount and payment have usually been calculated.

label: @LOANPROJECTPAYMENTCOUNT
description: Total number of payments

label: @LOANPROJECTFINALPAYMENT
description: Amount of final payment

label: @LOANPROJECTFINALDUEDATE
description: Due date of final payment

label: @LOANPROJECTTOTALINTEREST
description: Total interest paid

label: @LOANPROJECTTOTALPAYMENTS
description: Total of all payments

label: @LOANPROJECTTOTALESCROW
description: Total escrow amount paid

label: @LOANPROJECTLIFE
description: Life insurance total premiums returned from LOANPROJECTCALC. Also, if you set @LOANPROJECTSINGLEPREMIUM to 2, you pass the precalculated single premium amount that pulls from the loan or application field.

label: @LOANPROJECTDISABILITY
description: Disability total premiums returned from LOANPROJECTCALC. Also, if you set @LOANPROJECTSINGLEPREMIUM to 2, you pass the precalculated single premium amount that pulls from the loan or application field.

label: @LOANPROJECTLIFEERROR
description: Returned from LOANPROJECTCALC as blank, or as an exception description if there is a problem calculating life insurance

label: @LOANPROJECTDISABILITYERROR
description: Returned from LOANPROJECTCALC as blank, or as an exception description if there is a problem calculating disability

label: @LOANPROJECTAPR
description: Annual percentage rate if @LOANPROJECTPREPAIDFINANCECHG is non-zero

label: @LOANPROJECTERROR
description: If an error occurs during the calculation, this variable contains the error text.

label: @LOANPROJECTAMOUNTPAYOFF
description: The amount required to pay off the loan on the payoff date

label: @LOANPROJECTINTERESTPAYOFF
description: The amount of the loan balance due to accrued interest

label: @LOANPROJECTAMOUNTPASTDUE
description: The amount the system considers to be past due by the specified payoff date

label: @LOANPROJECTCOUNTPASTDUE
description: The number of payments the system considers to be past due by the specified payoff date

label: @LOANPROJECTLATECHGDUE
description: The total amount of any late charges due on the loan

label: @LOANPROJECTBILLEDFEEPAYOFF
description: The amount due on a non-interest-accruing periodic fee a member must pay for having available certain types of credit

label: @LOANPROJECTSALESTAXPAYOFF
description: The amount of remaining sales tax the member must pay to the state at the time of payoff

label: @LOANPROJECTINSURANCEPAYOFF
description: The amount of remaining insurance the member must pay at the time of payoff

label: @LOANPROJECTTERMINATEFEEPAYOFF
description: The optional fee charged for a lease loan payoff before the Balloon Date

label: @LOANPROJECTPURCHASEPRINCIPAL
description: The purchase principal balance at the time of the payoff calculation. Unpaid insurance premiums are included in this amount

label: @LOANPROJECTCASHADVPRINCIPAL
description: The cash advance principal balance at the time of the payoff calculation

label: @LOANPROJECTFEEPRINCIPAL
description: The fee balance at the time of the payoff calculation

label: @LOANPROJECTUNPAIDPURCHASEINT
description: The unpaid finance charge on purchases from previous statement cycles. This amount does not include finance charges due for the current statement cycle

label: @LOANPROJECTUNPAIDCASHADVINT
description: The unpaid finance charge due on cash advances from previous statement cycles. This amount does not include finance charges due for the current statement cycle

label: @LOANPROJECTCUTOFFPURCHASEINT
description: The finance charge due on purchases from the day after the last Statement Date through the specified Payoff Date. The system uses the same grace period analysis used during statement cutoff to compute this amount. This amount does not include finance charges due from previous statement cycles

label: @LOANPROJECTCUTOFFCASHADVINT
description: The finance charge due on cash advances from the day after the last Statement Date through the specified Payoff Date. This amount includes cash advance transaction finance charges for the current statement cycle, but does not include finance charges due from previous statement cycles

label: @LOANPROJECTCUTOFFCATRANSINT
description: The total cash advance transaction finance charge due on cash advances from the day after the last Statement Date through the specified Payoff Date. This amount is included in the Cutoff Cash Adv Interest amount

label: @LOANPROJECTCUTOFFBTTRANSINT
description: The total balance transfer transaction finance charge due on balance transfers from the day after the last Statement Date through the specified Payoff Date

label: @LOANPROJECTCUTOFFBALXFRINT
description: The finance charge due on balance transfers from the day after the last Statement Date through the specified Payoff Date

label: @LOANPROJECTUNPAIDBALXFRINT
description: The unpaid finance charges on balance transfers from previous statement cycles

label: @LOANPROJECTBALXFRPRINCIPAL
description: The balance transfer principal balance at the time of the payoff calculation
